election_record.label: Maryland 1801 Electoral Assembly for State Senate, Prince George's County

overview.note: "From Nottingham: I take the liberty to inclose you a statement of the poll in the Lower, or Nottingham District, as taken from the books by one of the judges, after the poll was closed at 8 o'clock last night." National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC). September 11, 1801.
The American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC) list a Republican majority of 86 votes.

sub_unit.name: Bladensburg
sub_unit.note: The American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC) list a Republican majority of 8 votes.

sub_unit.name: Piscataway
sub_unit.note: The American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC) list a Federalist majority of 290 votes.

sub_unit.name: Upper Marlboro
sub_unit.note: "Republican majority 34 in Upper Marlboro'." National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC). September 11, 1801.
The American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC) list a Republican majority of 33 votes.

sub_unit.name: Vansville
sub_unit.note: The American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD) and The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC) list a Republican majority of 175 votes.

election_record.reference: American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). September 11, 1801.
National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser (Washington, DC). September 11, 1801.
The City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC) (Charleston, SC). September 26, 1801.
